page.title: 05Farming and Agriculture
page.content: The area is almost entirely devoted to rearing stock with virtually no arable land. This has not altered over the years, since the OSA mentions Hamilton's main crop to be potatoes, plus the rearing of animals. {STOCK REARING} Stock is reared for two purposes. a) Dairy Farming. b) Fattening for sale. Sheep are raised- mostly for sale, but also in some cases for their wool. {AGRICULTURE} The land is overwhelming grassland - divided in permanent pasture and laid where the grass is improved and cut for silage. Arable land is usually used for root-crops and is comparati- vely small in acreage. There is no commercial forestry, but some market gardening on a small scale.
